meanings.definition: Moving slowly and quietly in a stealthy or cautious manner.
meanings.sent1: The cat was creeping up on the unsuspecting bird.
meanings.sent2: The creeping fog enveloped the town in a mysterious haze.
meanings.sent3: The creeping shadows made the room feel like a spooky movie set.
meanings.sent4: The creeping vines of ivy seemed to strangle the old building.
meanings.sent5: The creeping sensation of being watched sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: Spreading or growing gradually or unnoticed.
meanings.sent1: The creeping ivy covered the entire wall over time.
meanings.sent2: The creeping rumor about the new teacher spread quickly among students.
meanings.sent3: The creeping mold in the damp corner was like a tiny forest.
meanings.sent4: The creeping influence of social media can be seen in everyday life.
meanings.sent5: The creeping realization of his mistake dawned on him slowly.

meanings.definition: An adjective used to describe something that causes a feeling of unease or fear.
meanings.sent1: The creeping darkness in the forest made her heart race.
meanings.sent2: The creeping sense of dread lingered in the air after the movie.
meanings.sent3: The creeping sound of footsteps behind her made her jump.
meanings.sent4: The creeping feeling of being followed haunted her every step.
meanings.sent5: The creeping fear of the unknown gripped her tightly.

meanings.definition: The act of advancing or progressing slowly or gradually.
meanings.sent1: The creeping of the glacier reshaped the landscape over centuries.
meanings.sent2: The creeping of time eventually reveals all secrets.
meanings.sent3: The creeping of the snail amused the children in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The creeping of technology into our lives changes how we interact.
meanings.sent5: The creeping of the seasons brings new colors to the world.
